reviewText: Brotherhood of Death was interesting, to say the least. It's about a group of black friends that go to Vietnam, which could have been an entire movie all to itself, and then come back home to a town that's run by the KKK. I think it's safe to say that I don't need to describe what happens between the two groups. While a bit slow in places, it does end up being fun to watch overall.One Down Two To Go was the better of the two films for me. It's about a fighting tournament that ends up having rigged fights. Some of the fighters figure this out and go out to try and get the cash for themselves.
summary: If you enjoy blaxsploitation, you'll like these

reviewText: I watched One Down Two to Go twice in a week.  I love Fred The Hammer, and both Jims - but this is the best movie I've seen any of them in (Including the awesome prequel, Three the Hard Way).  I laughed, said WHOA, and left feeling more satisfied than almost any movie has had me feeling.

reviewText: Jim Brown,Fred Williamson two of the N.F.L.'s all time greatest,along with Martial Art's sensation Jim Kelly,plus(SHAFT'S)Richard Roundtree.How could you go wrong with a collaboration like that.A very Impressive line up to say the least.But I'll be honest with you I expected it to be a lot better.Now "Three The Hard Way",was definately the better of the collaboration film's.But if you got a couple extra dollar's$ lying around...get it.If anything it'll make a great collector's item.
